column1: length ball, not much of movement, as Imam lets it go
length ball, a hint of away swing, and Imam comes forward and defends
drifts down the leg side, and allows him to glance down to fine leg
drifts down the leg side to Hafeez this time, who tucks him away on the onside comfortably
length ball and Imam comes forward and drives it with conviction. There isn't much movement on offer, and the spinners might be summoned quicker than normal today
outside off, and offering some width, and Imam lays into it. Drives forcefully and in the gap between cover and point. Fine shot!

length ball, that comes back in and they have appealed. Turned down. They have gone for a review though, possibly for a caught behind. It passes close to the bat, but doesn't seem to have taken either bat or glove. Hafeez was pressing forward and looking to defend, the ball cut back in sharply to beat the inside edge. The umpire might have a look at the LBW shot, but it bounces above.
length ball, and he again presses forward and defends. Needs to be wary of playing across the line, especially with the bowler essentially bowling cutters
comes forward to another length ball, and this time is able to nudge it away with soft hands to the onside
length ball, that angles across him. He plays it down defensively from the crease after standing up on his toes
angles across him, and he watches it through with his bat raised. The line was far too outside off-stump for him to be tempted
angles across him again, and he comes forward and defends. Gets a little inside edge of the bat, and also plays a little off balance
angles across him, and he shoulders arms to it
angles across, and Hafeez looks to leave it, but the ball takes his bat as he was about to take it out of the way. Thankfully, crept along the floor to the gully region
pitched outside off and looking to tempt him into the drive, but Hafeez lets this pass
angles across him again, and he shoulders arms to this one
angles across Hafeez, who lets this pass through to the keeper
a straighter ball, but Hafeez has no problems in coming forward and defending
angles outside off, and he lets this pass
angles across Imam, and then straightens a touch off the seam. Good carry through to the keeper, as the batsman shoulders arms to it
beautifully struck drive! Pitched up again by de Grandhomme, and he comes forward and gets right over the ball as he eases it through covers
terrific response from the bowler! A bit more pace in this as he gets it to slant across Imam, and beats his outside edge as the batsman presses forward
shorter in length, and straighter. He hangs back and defends

DROPPED! It's angled across Imam, and he goes for the drive again. This time, his feet didn't move as much, and that led to him getting the outside edge. It was travelling quickly to Latham at second slip, who failed to latch on
angles across Hafeez, who is only too happy not to need to play the new ball at this stage
length ball, straightens a bit into the right-hander, who plays it defensively off the crease
short and wide outside off. Hafeez was looking to play the upper cut to it, but missed it by a fair margin
length ball, and a bit of movement back in. Hafeez lets this go, and it passes over off-stump. Some good bounce on offer this time for Boult!
straighter ball, but just drifts into the pads. Hafeez flicks it away to square leg
angles across Hafeez, and from a good length. He is opened up a bit, but does well to play it with soft hands to the offside
angles across Imam and beats his outside edge. Great ball, especially as it reared off a length, and went away with the seam. Too good for the left-handed opener
pitched up a bit more, and this time Imam can press forward and cover the seam movement and defend
angles across him, and from a good length, but he lets this pass without getting tempted into a drive
pitched up, angled across, and he comes forward and plays a defensive drive straight down to mid-off
angled across, and he lets it pass
a little shorter in length, but the line is similar, as it slants across Imam. The batsman goes back and defends it with soft hands to the offside
straighter ball, and Hafeez goes back and defends this
tries to bowl this straighter, but drifts down the leg side, and Hafeez glances it fine, and the outfield does the rest
length ball, and a good leave from Hafeez. The ball cuts back, but the bounce is true, and it passes well over the off stump
another terrific ball! Bowled at 136.4kph, and cuts back in sharply after pitching. Hafeez lets it go again, and it bounces over the top of middle this time
angles across, and is bowled at nearly 136kph this time. Hafeez lets it pass. Good contest brewing between the two experienced men...
pitched up, as he looks for swing, but again drifts into Hafeez's pads. He goes back and flicks it down to the long-leg region
outside off stump, and dying on the batsman. He shoulders arms and lets it through

first blood for New Zealand! This was again outside the off stump, and Hafeez for once got tempted into letting his bat hang out, and just took the outside edge. The ball was dying on its way to Tom Latham, but he was positioned low enough to scoop it up with ease. Makes up for the previous lapse from him, but a vital breakthrough inside the first hour
outside off, and moving away off the seam. Azhar watches it through without nibbling at it
CHANCE! A fuller ball, and Azhar gets tempted into going for the drive. It takes the outside edge, and somehow contrives to go perfectly between Watling and Taylor at first slip!
outside off, and this time it cuts back in after pitching. Azhar judges this one better, as he shoulders arms
outside off and moving further away. He lets it pass through
pitched up, and a hint of swing away from Imam, who comes forward and plays a loud, resounding forward defensive stroke to it!
a little shorter, and Imam goes back to this ball pitched on off stump and defends it to the offside
outside off and moving further away. He lets it pass without fiddling at it
length ball, that jags back in. Imam caught in the crease, and gets hit in front of the stumps. The bounce would probably have taken it over the stumps, though
fuller ball, and a hint of movement away, as Imam comes forward to defend. This is another good spell of pressure coming from Boult. Excellent new-ball bowling, especially for the conditions...
shorter in length, outside off, and Imam lets it pass
outside off, and on a length as it swings away. Azhar comes forward but refuses to be drawn into a shot
a little fuller, and again on off stump. The ball keeps a bit low, as Azhar shoulders arms.
fuller, and he comes to the length of it and eases it through covers. A much better shot, with the right footwork to match

GONE! Air of inevitability about this, as de Grandhomme has been homing in on that line outside off stump. Another cutter that goes across him, and Imam goes forward looking to defend it, but gets the outside edge of the bat. Carries nicely to Latham, who makes no mistake this time. What a start this has been for New Zealand!
outside off stump again, and he gets tempted into going for a drive. Not far from the outside edge...
outside off stump, angles across Sohail, who shoulders arms
length ball, angles across Azhar, who lets it pass
length ball, that straightens after pitching. Azhar lets it pass, and it goes quite close to the off-stump...
outside off and angling away again, and Azhar lets this pass
straighter, but down to the pads, and he lofts it over the man at square leg
outside off and angles away off a good length, and he shoulders arms to it
angles across, pitched up, and he lets it pass without playing at it
length ball, and straightens into Sohail, who presses forward and defends it
looks to angle it across the left-hander, but pitches it far too wide outside off. Sohail watches it through
comes forward to a length ball and defends it
length ball, and outside off. He lets this pass. Is de Grandhomme just tiring out a touch?
length ball, angles across Sohail, and moves prodigously after leaving the batsman. Some 'oohs' and 'aahs' from behind the wicket, as the batsman shoulders arms
pitched up, and straightens into him. Good shot by Azhar in response, though, as he drives it through the mid-on region
pitching on a length, and straightening again into Azhar, who goes back and defends this
OUTSIDE EDGE! Angles across Azhar, but he does well to take his bottom hand off. It goes along the ground, and moves beyond the second slip, and bounces away towards gully
fuller ball, and Sohail gets behind the line of this straighter ball and plays it down to the onside
length ball, outside off, and draws him into a drive. Sohail plays it from the crease, but plays it away defensively through the offside
short ball, and on off stump, as Sohail ducks into it. Some decent bounce on this, but nothing to worry batsmen on either side. The pitch, by and large, is low and slow.
straight ball, angling into Azhar, who goes back and flicks it on the onside
pitched up, and hits him on the pads. There's a half-hearted appeal for LBW, but the angle was taking it down the leg side
length ball, outside off, and tempts Azhar into pressing forward and dropping it with a dead bat
fuller, and outside off stump again. This time Azhar comes forward and looks to drive, but cannot hit it with much conviction, as the bat turns in his hands
outside off stump, and goes on straight, as Azhar prefers to shoulder arms to this one
pitched on off, and he comes forward and defends.
length at leg stump, flicked into the leg side
full and dipping into off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
bouncer at an off stump line, makes him duck hurriedly
full and shaping away late just outside off. Gets him playing at this on the initial angle and then reaching out with the late swing. It's poked into the covers
length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
full outside off, punches it on the up to mid-off's right. Boult slides across and just gets a hand on it
full on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
full at off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
overpitched outswinger, just outside off. Nice stride forward to carve this to cover's left
length ball wide outside off, left alone
overpitched outswinger, wider outside off this time and nearly sucks him into driving. But Azhar refuses, lets it go
length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, defended down the pitch off the front foot
past the outside edge. He's toying with Haris with that angle in now. This one straightens off the surface as he looks to defend in front of off stump
outswinger now and he gets him to play away from the body. This is very very good Test bowling. Again with the angle inwards, but swings it away late. Haris losing his shape quite a bit against him
lovely shot. But it is straight into the stumps at the other end. Overpitched straight ball. He shuffles and drives firmly with the full face offered
bouncer down leg side, ducks to let it go
full and dipping in at off stump. Shuffles and defends hurriedly out to mid-off
length and slanting across the corridor. Left alone
overpitched just outside off, stabbed to mid-off with the outside half
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
length ball just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended into the covers
length on middle stump, defended to mid-on on the up
length at middle stump, tapped to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length in at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball on leg stump, forced to duck and let it go
length and in at off stump, looks to defend from the crease. Barely gets the outside half on this
length on off stump, hangs the bat out and this flies off the thick inside edge through square leg
leading edge as Boult brings one in to off stump. Length ball has him closing the face on the angle
length and in at leg stump, pushed uppishly to midwicket
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length at middle stump, nicely tucked off the hips to square leg's left
short of a length and in at leg stump, tapped to short midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, pushed with the turn to midwicket
full outside of, blocked into the covers
full outside off, flicked to short midwicket
length ball outside off, left alone
full on off stump, pokes with hard hands and gets a thick inside edge past short midwicket
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
thick edge between second slip and gully. Once again, he's driving inside the line of a ball angled in as it straightens
length at off stump, defended into the covers
beaten. Length ball in the corridor and he has a swish at it without moving his feet. Completely locked down, physically and mentally at the moment
outside edge again as he chases an outswinger away from his body. Opens the face at the last moment and it is in that gap in the cordon again
falls short of midwicket. Full and in at leg stump, flicked hurriedly with the front leg locked tightly across but not too far forward
length just outside off, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, gets low and paddles it fine with a big stride
short and just outside off, backs away and stabs it past slip off the thick outside edge
tossed up at off stump, driven with the turn to cover
well placed. That's good from Azhar. Short ball lifting up outside off, and he backs away and steers this cut wide of cover
full on middle stump, driven back down the pitch
length ball just outside off, pushes at it and misses
length outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
short ball wide outside off, left alone
full on off stump, tapped towards mid-off on the front foot
length at leg stump, solidly defended to mid-on
falls short of second slip. Full ball moving late just outside off stump. Gets him driving at this and it doesn't carry
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
inside edge past short leg. Length outside off, turns in and pings off the bat to short fine
tossed up wide outside off, driven sweetly but he can't get past the diving Williamson at extra cover
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
length outside off, defends on the front foot, slightly inside the line
slower ball, full outside off. Leans into this and drives on the up to extra cover's left. Another diving save
short of a length just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
full and just outside off. Opens the face and runs it square into the off side
length outside off, defended to short leg off the front foot
rips back in sharply and takes the inside edge onto pad by the looks of it, because this lbw decision is turned down
sharp turn in again and catches him on the front foot, but he's got outside the line
full outside off, defended to cover
length outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, gets forward and opens the face to slice this. Can't beat backward point
big lbw appeal but they won't chance their last review. Length ball slanted in and thuds him in front of leg stump as he gets back to try and tickle it fine. Going down
full on middle stump, pushes with hard hands and gets an inside edge to square leg
length outside off, left alone
full and just outside off, driven sweetly with a high elbow, but Wagner leaps big to his right to stop this
full and just outside off, left alone
straight ball that allows Sohail to move back and flick it away to long leg
straight ball, and Azhar plays it with a dead bat off the crease
length ball, jags back in, and takes the inside of the bat as Azhar jams down on it on the front foot
outside off, length ball, dying on the keeper, as Azhar lets it go
length ball, straighter at the batsman, who comes forward and defends. Is forced to take his bottom hand off
length ball, and straight at him, and he plays it away to short midwicket
straight ball, on a length, and he comes forward and defends it
length ball, at about 128kph, outside off stump, and Sohail lets it pass. Dying on its way through to Watling again
outside off, and again on a good length. Sohail lets it pass, as it goes straight with the angle of the left-armer bowling over the wicket
length ball, that cuts back in after pitching. Sohail gets behind it and defends away to the offside
shorter in length, but angling into him. He goes back and defends this
dug in short, but angling down the legside. Sohail ducks inside this one
short and outside off, and Azhar cuts, but cannot beat point with his shot
straighter ball, and this time he allows it come to his pads, before pulling out a dead bat
straighter ball, on a length, and he goes back and defends this
outside off, on a good length, and he comes forward and dabs it defensively on the offside
shorter in length, but straight, and he hangs back and defends
straight ball, and he plays it defensively off the backfoot
looking for some swing, he pitches it on leg. Almost squares up Sohail, who had already made his mind up to defend. Eventually plays it defensively down to mid-on
length ball, shaping back into him. He plays it from the crease and dead-bats it
straight ball on off stump, and he comes forward and defends
outside off, and moving further away. Sohail watches it through and lets it pass
good length, outside off stump, and just in the right channel to tempt him into a drive. Sohail resists, and shoulders arms. Good bowling...
length ball, and straight, and he goes back and defends.
outside off stump, and he lets it pass through
pitched up, but going into the pads a bit. Azhar looks to whip it away on the onside, but finds a man at square leg
straighter and fuller, and he drives it straight down the wicket
strays down the pads, and Azhar is able to flick it away. Tends to fall over while playing on the onside, which could explain the two men catching at midwicket, as well as the line
outside off, and he chops it back on his foot as he tries to defends. Feet went nowhere
straighter ball, and he defends it. Shouts of 'catch it' but it fell way short of the man at short midwicket
length ball, but starts way outside off stump. Azhar is happy to let it pass
angles this across him, off a good length. Azhar has a good look at it...and lets it go through

straighter ball, and he punches it back past the bowler. The man at mid-on does well to get across to it, but Boult cannot stop it completely. The cleanup operations are helped by mid-off, who gets across quickly
pitched up, and he drives it. Straight to Ish Sodhi at covers. A smattering of ironic applause from the stands
length ball outside off, and he comes forward and defends
comes forward to a length ball and defends
length ball, angling across him, and he comes forward and defends
outside off stump, on a good length, and he shoulders arms
length ball, just moving away from him from the stumps, and he comes forward and defends on the offside
length ball, angles across him, and he presses forward and shoulders arms
length ball, straighter in line, and he comes forward and drives it straight down to mid-on
outside off stump and moving further away
outside off stump, and width on offer, and he flashes hard at it, and forces it away past Williamson at point. Wasn't too far from the New Zealand captain!
length ball, outside off, and Azhar defends from the crease
dug in short, and it doesn't rise much, outside off, as Azhar watches it through to the keeper
length ball, comes in with the angle, and Azhar nurdles it away defensively to short midwicket
length ball, just on offstump, and Azhar defends compactly
length ball, and he presses forward and defends
length ball turning in, and he defends
tossed up, and he comes out of the crease, and punts this over midwicket. Not quite off the middle of the blade, but good enough to get him his first runs in 22 balls!
comes forward and defends a length ball turning in from off
big turn from outside off into him. He goes back and the ball comes off his pad into the hands of short leg
length ball, outside off, turning in, and he comes forward and defends
comes forward and defends another length ball
tries to further the angle by going wider of the crease, but strays on to the pads even further. Azhar can just turn it around the corner off his pads
length ball on off stump, to which Sohail presses forward. Gets the outer edge of the bat, but keeps it down as it goes towards point
angles across Azhar, who lets this one pass
starts from beyond leg stump and swings further away from Azhar, who does well to get some bat on it. Flies away towards fine leg, beyond an exasperated Watling dive
angles outside off and further away, and he lets it pass

outside off, and pitched up, and this time Azhar plays it with an open face of the bat. Guides it between the area between second slip and gully, but along the ground. Controlled shot, that also brings up the 50-run partnership
shorter in length, and the natural angle allows Sohail to go back and work it away on the onside, keeping it low enough to not bring short leg into play
tossed up, and Azhar comes forward to smother the spin on it
this time, it's a bit short, and he goes back and cuts to the man stationed at deep cover
goes back and defends a length ball turning into him
comes forward and defends a length ball on offstump
fired in a bit quicker, on offstump, and aiming at the footmarks. Doesn't turn as much, but Sohail defends confidently and comfortably off the backfoot
length ball, on off stump, and he goes back and defends straight down the pitch
outside off stump, and he has a whiff at it. Lost his shape completely, and also let one hand off the handle. The ball goes under the bat, thankfully!
length ball, angling into him, and he defends
shorter ball, and he ducks inside it
straighter ball, and he does well to play it away on the on-side and calling his partner through for a quick single
straighter ball, and he defends it off the front foot
presses forward and defends a length ball
tossed up, and he sweeps. It's uppish, but there's no fielder at midwicket, and this trickles away for a boundary. The run rate in the last few overs has seen a bit of a boost, hasn't it?
comes forward again to a length ball outside off, and tries to drive it, but doesn't get much of bat on it
length ball, and he comes forward to drive
flatter and straighter, and he goes back and cuts this
length ball on offstump, and he comes forward to smother the spin
length ball from Boult, but straight at the stumps. He plays it comfortably off the front foot
length ball, but just outside off, and allows Sohail to open the face of the bat and steer it towards backward point
yorker, and came out of the blue! Well dug out by Sohail
length ball, straightening into him, and he comes forward and drives it defensively. Straight to Sodhi at silly mid-on
short and outside off, and Sohail ducks inside this one. Did keep the periscope up, though...
straight length ball, and he flicks it away on the onside, keeping it down and wide of the man stationed at short midwicket
tossed up, wide of offstump, and gets him to come forward and defend
outside off, gets the outside edge too, but dies on its way to Ross Taylor at first slip!
length ball outside off, hits the footmarks and doesn't turn much. Sohail pushes it away off the back foot through gully
full length ball, and he comes down on it with an angled bat, that gives him a single to midwicket
comes forward and smothers a length ball on offstump
outside off, and he drives it off the front foot. Stopped by de Grandhomme, but can't prevent the single
fuller length ball, but straying down the pads. Sohail is able to nurdle it away, even as Watling lets out a stifled appeal for leg before
length ball, and he goes back and defends it away on the onside
length ball, a little slower through the air. Azhar goes back and defends, and taps it away to the offside. Thinks of a quick single, but there's no harm in letting that be
outside off, length ball, and he drives it through towards cover

width on offer, and he forces it away on the offside. FIFTY for Azhar! Good knock, this. Has been patient and has been zen-like in concentration. Don't forget, he could have gone for a second-ball duck, if either of Watling or Taylor had reacted quicker!
angled away, and he lets it pass
tossed up wide outside off, gets the front leg down the pitch and pummels this drive through cover. No stopping that
full outside off, flicked to midwicket with the turn
length and just outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
length outside off, nudged to midwicket's left with the turn
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
tossed up outside off, driven on the bounce to short extra
lobbed up at a length outside off, defended into the turf on the off side
dropped short and turning back in sharply at off stump. Backs away and chops it to deep point
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to short extra
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper's right with the turn
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
short of a length and turning back into the corridor. Defended on the back foot, outside the line of off
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, smothered into the off side
length outside off, driven straight to extra cover
pumps it into the empty stands over long-off. Good option from Azhar. Length outside off, steps out and launches it with a turn, on the up
past the outside edge. Back you go, says Ajaz. Flatter but dipping on a length outside off. Draws him forward and beats him on the defence
length outside off, driven past the bowler to mid-off
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the inside half
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
tossed up on off stump, tapped to long-on after meeting it on the full
full outside off, looks to drive through off side but this comes on slow. Trickles to mid-on off the inside edge
full on off stump, driven to mid-off with the turn
full outside off, stabbed to short extra
big appeal for lbw as Sohail is caught on the move and struck in front of middle. That spun and rose steeply, was missing the stumps possibly
length outside off, defended on the front foot
full toss on off stump, flicked to long-on
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball turning and rising outside off. Looks to sweep it, appears premeditated. Because that was too short for the sweep. It's a one-handed heave to slice it over leg slip in the end
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven with the turn to long-off
length on the stumps, defended into the leg side
tossed up outside off, driven inside-out to extra cover
length ball turning into off stump. Defended to short leg off the back foot
full on leg stump, defended into the leg side
full outside off, defended into the pitch
length on middle stump, poked into the midwicket region with the front leg planted across off stump
length outside off, steps out and pokes into the covers
full outside off, driven to short extra cover
length outside off, left alone
length on off stump, dipping and then spinning away from off stump. Thick outside edge to point's left on the forward block
length outside off, steps out and drives with the turn to short extra
length at off stump, defended to cover on the up
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball hooping in at leg stump, blocked on the front foot to mid-on
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
length at leg stump, defended solidly into the leg side
tossed up outside off, driven with the turn to short extra's left
length just outside off, goes on the back foot and stabs it to backward point's right
tossed up outside off, sliced to sweeper's left
length on middle stump, flicked to short leg off the back foot
outside edge. Googly from Sodhi, from around the wicket. Haris pushes forward, but with soft hands. It falls short of slip
length on leg stump, flicked to backward square
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, leans back and chops to deep point
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
bouncer at a leg stump line. Ducks under it
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
short and just outside off. Cut to backward point's right
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, flicked short midwicket
length at off stump, defended to short leg with the turn
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, pushed to short leg with the turn
length and just outside off, soft-handed forward block to point
length on off stump, pushed to point's left
length on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket's left
length and in at off stump, defended down the pitch
length on off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, tapped to short extra cover on the up
dropped very short and wide outside off. Pulled to mid-on's right off the toe end
full on leg stump, poked down to long-on with the turn
full on off stump, driven to sweeper with the turn
length at middle stump, defended pitch side into the leg side

tossed up outside off, met as a full toss that he tries to caress wide of mid-off. CDG puts in a dive there and misses with his throw to the non-striker's end, where Haris is struggling to complete the run
short of a length outside off, tapped to point with the turn
length outside off, defended to point
full on leg stump, flicked to square leg
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, defended from deep in the crease
length outside off, defended to cover on the front foot
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length outside off, hurriedly tapped square into the off side
googly, ripping in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
length ball pushed through flat at off stump. Dead-batted on the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off with the turn
full on off stump, driven to short extra's right
short of a length on leg stump, gets on the back foot and punches to deep midwicket's left
pitches it up, angles it in, and he comes forward and defends
angles into him, and just outside off stump. He defends off the crease
length ball on off stump and he defends
pitched up, and he gets on top of it and plays it away to the onside. Risky if he can't maintain his balance, as it will bring LBW into play
fuller length, and he comes forward and defends
outside off and he leaves it alone
big turn, from a length as it spins across him
JAFFA! Pitches outside off, turns in sharply, may have taken a bit of bat, but hit the pad and then fell just ahead of slips
reaches out to a length balll, and drives it down to long-on
curved into towards the pads, and then takes big turn away from the leg stump. Forces Azhar to defend off the backfoot
speared in towards the pads again, and he goes back to defend
reaches out to a length ball and drives it down to third man
angles back into him, and he defends off the front foot. Stifled leg-before appeals, as Wagner thought it may have struck the pad first
length ball, straight at him, and he comes forward and defends
outside off stump, on a good length, and he defends after pressing forward
outside off, and on a length. Azhar resists the temptation to play at it
short, and this time he swivels onto the backfoot and tucks it away, rolling his wrists, in working it down to fine leg
straight, at about 132kph, and he comes forward to defend it
length ball on middle stump, and he comes forward to defend
tossed up, invites the drive, and he gets to the pitch of it before driving
angled into leg stump, and there's a little bit of turn for him. Azhar plays it away comfortably on the onside
tossed up, and this time he forces it away through the covers by opening the face of the bat
tossed up outside off, and big turn back in. Slow, though, and allows Sohail ample time to rock back and push it towards the point region
goes back and defends a length ball straightening after pitching on leg
anging down the leg side, and Sohail thinks about having a go at it, and it just passes through to Watling, who looks like he might appeal for a moment
straightens into him, off a length, and he plays it defensively to short midwicket
outside off, and he lets this one pass
length ball, and straightens into him. He drives it down to mid-on
length on off stump, and he plays it with a straight bat towards mid-off
short, and wide, and he latches on to it, driving it through the vacant backward point region. Good shot!
the googly! And had him beaten all ends up. Pitched on middle, and he went back to it, and found himself tied up. Inside edge onto his thigh, thankfully
short this time, and allows Azhar to go back and biff it away through covers after it turns away from him
tossed up, and he drives against the turn, but into the gap between short cover and mid-off
DROPPED SHORT OF TAYLOR AT SLIP! Tossed up, and turned big, and took the outside edge, and landed just short of Ross Taylor at slip
tossed up, and again he drives off the edge, and it lands just short of point
tossed up, and he plays it defensively on the onside this time
angling into Sohail, and he plays it off his hips into the square leg region. Sohail looks a lot more comfortable with his footwork now
outside off, on a length, and he gets behind the line to defend
lenglength ball, he goes back and defends
outside off, and he smacks this behind point. Emphatic way to complete FIFTY!
full toss, and he defends
dug in shorter, and he weaves out of the way
comes forward to a length ball and defends
goes back to a shorter ball and cuts it, but cannot beat point
flighted, and he comes forward and plays it with the turn towards the on-side as the ball straightens
shorter in length, and he flicks it away towards square leg
straight length ball and he drives it back to the bowler
straight ball, and he comes forward to smother the spin on it
straight ball, coming in with the angle, and he defends with a dead bat
strays on to the pads, and he flicks him away
length ball, cutting in with the angle of the ball, and allows him to play it away to the onside with soft hands
length ball, and he defends.
angles across him, and he plays it defensively on the offside
pitched up, but again a cutter on offstump, and he comes forward to defend
loopy ball on a good length at offstump, and he comes forward and defends
tossed up, but too full, and allows Azhar time and space to drive it away on the offside with the turn
cuts back in sharply from outside off, and he goes back and pushes it away towards point
tossed up, and he goes back and cuts straight to point
tossed up again, and he goes back and plays a cut just from under his eyes
looks for a well-tossed ball, but ends up serving a full toss well outside off. Azhar forces it away to the sweeper on the cover fence
down the leg side, and Watling whips the bails off as Azhar looks to glance it. Made sure his backfoot was moored inside, though
straight ball, he defends it down the wicket
straight ball, cutting back into him, and he works it away on the onside. Beats short midwicket, but can't go for runs
angling into him, and strays down the pads, allowing an easy leg-glance down to fine leg
starts from outside offstump and keeps going away with the angle, and Sohail lets it pass
straight ball, pitched further up, and he drives it down to mid-off
goes onto the back foot and eases it towards covers
comes forward to a length ball, and allows it to hit him as he smothers the spin
uses his feet again to try and counter the turn, and plays it back to Ajaz
shorter in length, and allows him to hang back and maneouvre it away to the onside through midwicket
Sohail uses his feet too, and chips down to take the ball on a half-volley and drive it down to long-on

GONE UPSTAIRS FOR A RUNOUT CALL HERE! It was tossed up, and he drove it to the substitute Tim Southee, at mid-off, and set off straight away, was sent back by the non-striker immediately, but the throw has caught him out. That's a terrible way to break what was a very useful resistance, but New Zealand won't be complaining!
outside off stump, on a length and he drives it to short cover
length ball, straightens after pitching, and Sohail gets right behind it to defend
fuller and outside off-stump, and this time he drives, but can't get it past extra cover
comes forward to defend a length ball
length ball, outside off stump, and he lets it pass
pitched up, and he drives, but cannot beat the man at extra cover
tossed up around off stump, and he comes forward and defends
big turn! Pitches on off and has turn and bounce to beat the batsman, and taken by Watling above his right shoulder
action replay of the previous ball, but this time Shafiq doesn't nibble at it
bowled wide of the crease, and turns after pitching. He comes forward to defend

shorter in length, and lots of turn on offer. He goes back and cuts it. Half-stopped by the fielder, and there was some indecision in the running, but they eventually crossed over once Boult misfielded
tossed up, and turning back in sharply, and he defends off the back foot
straight ball, and he goes back to defend
outside off, and on a length, just a hint of movement back in, but Shafiq lets it pass

way outside off stump, and he lets it pass
length ball, he plays it from the crease with a dead bat
length ball, straight at him, and he defends off the front foot
length at middle stump, defended towards short leg off the inside half
length at off stump, defended to point
length outside off, cut to backward point
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, gets into the leg side and whips this sweep to short fine who fumbles
full on leg stump, flicked to square leg's right
length ball pushed down leg side, can't get bat on it
length at middle stump, tapped to mid-on
length at leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
full outside off, driven on the front foot to mid-on
length at off stump, defended solidly into the covers

short and wide outside off, backs away and slaps it to the cover boundary
length at middle stump, flicks it to long-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, smothers the turn and dead-bats into the off side
short and wide outside off, backs away and hammers it firmly to the extra cover boundary
lovely hit. Length ball wide outside off, gets right down, almost under it as it bounces, and swipes it to deep square. Great mobility
length ball in at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended solidly down the pitch
offcutter, lobbed up at a length on off stump. Defended into the covers
overpitched on leg stump, driven on the bounce to silly mid-on
length on leg stump, flicked straight to square leg
length outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
length ball looping down at an off stump line. Defended off the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted into the off side
length outside off, pushed into the covers off the front foot
length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
length on off, blocked on the front foot
big turn saves him from getting a tickle on that. Gets forward to defend outside off stump
length at leg stump, gets deep in the crease and whips it to fine leg
length at off stump, nicely behind this to defend off the back foot
ha! An extra less than five minutes after that stat. Length ball wide outside off, left alone. Decent enough ball except Wagner has overstepped
length outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball going slightly away from off. But comfortably defended on the front foot
full outside off, gets forward to defend with an angled bat. It pings into the leg side off the inside half
short and coming in at off stump. Backs away for the cut and keeps his eyes on it as it keeps climbing in. Chops it past first slip
length at off stump, gets forward and gets an inside edge as he looks to defend
full outside off, steps out and flicks to long-on
length ball just outside off, jumps out of the rough but he gets the bottom hand off and defends this
full outside off, dead-batted on the forward defence

Ajaz has the last laugh! Shafiq was right on top of him last over, but some old-fashioned tossing it up above the eyeline has won him this contest. Dips rapidly as Shafiq realises he's made a big mistake stepping out. In panic, he heaves wildly at it and gets a top edge that ends up at backward point. Woeful shot, that.
full and down leg side, allows it to come on and tickles it fine
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on it
length on leg stump, defended to silly mid-on
full on leg stump, tapped to silly mid-on
yorker down leg side, misses on the flick

short and wide outside off, gets back in the crease and slaps it past extra cover
length outside off, punched to short extra cover off the back foot
short of a length and rising up outside off, left alone
length ball jumping away from a middle stump line. Defended off the back foot
length at middle, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, drops it into the covers with soft hands
full inswinger at leg stump, watchfully poked to midwicket
length ball swinging in at middle and leg. Gets back in the crease and defends solidly
full inswinger at leg stump, flicked off the inside edge to square leg's right
full outswinger just outside off, left alone
length ball shaping away outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
full outside off, left alone
length ball curving away outside off, left alone
big shout for lbw but there's an inside edge on that. The old set up from CDG. Brings this closer to the stump and shapes it away. He's looking to defend on the front foot
length outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
full and wide outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
length ball angled in at the corridor, swinging away late. Left alone
short of a length and fizzing quickly past the hip as he looks to glance. Can't get bat on it
length ball outside off, left alone

handsome from Haris. Full outswinger outside off, leans nicely into this and punches with a high elbow past Southee at mid-off. Gives the chase and probably wishes he could run back in and bowl with that new ball, the 12th man
length ball just outside off, left alone
full inswinger at off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
oh so close! That cuts back in off the pitch, in the corridor. Doesn't cover off stump as he leaves this but it's safe
length outside off, left alone
in the air but hit firmly enough to get it past the bowler. Incoming ball, overpitched on middle stump and he stands tall and punches it past CDG, low to his right
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
shot. New ball perfect for the back foot punch on this slow pitch. Short of a length outside off and he carves it through cover
and another! What a gorgeous strokemaker this guy is. Short and wide outside off, solidly behind this. So much balance, not a tremor as he cuts this through cover point
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off
full and just outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball across off stump, left alone
woobly length ball wide outside off, left alone
clipped away with authority, past midwicket. Full inswinger on the pads and he leans in a touch and closes the face to get it away
full outside off, leans into it on the front foot and drives to sweeper's left
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
crunch. On top of the bounce once again as he gets on his toes. Tapped through cover point as this angles across him. Nicholls chases and tumbles to flick this back in
full outside off, sliced to deep point off the front foot
full on off stump, defended into the off side
length ball just outside off, defended towards gully off the back foot

comes in with the angle, and he flicks it away off the backfoot
comes down the wicket and flicks the ball through midwicket
goes back and drives a length ball towards cover
comes forward and defends a length ball on off stump

outside off, and moving further away, as Azam shoulders arms to this
strays down the pads, and he glances it away comfortably. Fine leg is too square to cut this out
straighter, and fuller, and he presses forward and defends
fuller ball, on off-stump, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, outside off, just keeps a bit low, as he leaves it
length ball on off-stump, and he comes forward to defend it with dead bat

tossed up, and he goes back to force it away on the offside with the turn
comes forward to smother the spin on a length ball pitched on off and middle

flighted again, and pitching on leg, this time Azam comes forward to smother it
goes back to a length ball and forces it through covers
angles across Sohail, who is squared up a bit, but is able to defend it away to the offside
outside off, and angling further away, and he lets it pass
angles across him, on a good length, trying to tempt him into a drive, but he watches it pass through with his arms raised
angles across him, but starts from outside off. He lets it pass

comes forward and plays it away defensively on the offside
tossed up, and Azam goes back and guides it past slip towards third man with an open face
presses forward to defend a ball on a length outside off
comes forward and defends a length ball on offstump
tossed up, and he presses forward, and the turn takes the inside edge, but lands to the right of short leg

uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball, on a length outside off, and smothers it away on the offside
length ball, but strays on to the pads, and he can tuck it away on the onside with a gentle nudge
outside off, from a length, and he lets it pass
angled way across the batsman, who isn't taking any of the bait on offer
straighter ball, but a bit shorter, and allows Sohail to tap it away to the offside
length ball, and Azam looks to work it away on the onside with a shuffle. The ball hits the pads, but was clearly sliding down leg

dangerous! Shoulders arms to a straight ball straightening into him. He chose not to play a shot, and the question before New Zealand could go for a review was whether it had straightened enough to go on to the off stump. They choose not to review it.
Sohail comes down the pitch to get closer to the ball again, and plays a length ball away to the onside
uses his feet, but this time ends up yorking himself, as the ball is fired on off. Skews a shot away to the onside
plays a length ball from the crease, just stretching enough to cover the spin, and pushes it through the offside
goes back to a shorter ball, and steers it towards mid-on against the spin
tossed up, and turning back in, but way outside off stump. Sohail lets it strike the pad after covering the turn
chips down the wicket, and takes the ball on the half-volley and glides it down to mid-on with the turn
outside off, and going straight on, and he lets it pass
length ball, angling into him, and he comes forward to defend it
straighter length ball, and he plays it away towards short midwicket
outside off, and moving back in, and Sohail shoulders arms
strays on to the pads with a fuller ball, and he flicks it away
pitched up, and he goes for the uppish drive, but is able to keep it wide of the man at short cover
beats Sohail with a length ball on offstump. Keeps low as it passes the edge
fuller ball, straightening into him, and he drives it defensively down the pitch
bowled from wider of the crease, and straightening into Sohail, who gets behind the line and defends
comes forward and defends a length ball straightening into him
length ball, and he goes back and gets on top of the ball and pushes it away on the offside
pitched up, and angling into him, and he defends it to the offside from the crease
length ball, pitching on leg and angling across him. Azam is opened up a bit, but able to play it away on the offside. Wants a quick single, but is turned down by Sohail
length ball, straight at him, and he goes back and defends
pitched up, and he comes forward and drives it towards mid-off. Confident stroke in this over for the first time
looks for a fuller ball, but ends up overcooking it. Azam takes it on the full and drives it straight past Boult, and wide of mid-off
length ball, and he presses forward to defend
outside off, and he latches on to this length ball and creams it towards the deep point fieldsman
length ball outside off stump, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, angles into him, and he comes forward and defends. Just beaten by the movement a bit, but adjusted late to get his bat down in the right line
fuller ball, and he looks to come forward and defend
fuller ball, but strays down the leg side, and it goes through past the batsman
length ball, and he presses forward to defend
fuller ball, curving into him, and he unleashes a beautiful on-drive, but Ajaz Patel at mid-on does well to cut it off
length ball on offstump, and he goes back and defends up on his toes
pitched up, outside off stump, and he defends. Thought for a while about playing an expansive stroke perhaps, but decided he was in no shape to do so
straighter ball, and fuller, and he drives. Does well to keep it low, as it rockets through to the man at short midwicket
length ball, and he goes back and defends
outside off, and dying on Watling as it goes through. Sohail watches like an uninterested bystander waiting for his cup of tea to be served
length ball, straightens into him, but he defends comfortably off the crease
length ball, on off, and Azam presses forward to defend
pitched up, and this time he drives it through covers. The fielder there failed to cut it off, and that allows a couple of runs to be taken easily
length ball, jags back in, and hits the pads, but surely took the inside edge of the bat first. A loud appeal at first, but then the New Zealanders get back to preparing for the next ball
straighter ball, and he comes forward and squirts it away to the onside
length ball on off stump, moving in, and again he presses forward to defend
length ball, but starts way outside off-stump, as Azam watches it through
length ball, outside off, and Sohail goes up on his toes and defends

length ball, and cutting back into him, and he defends

fuller ball, but strays onto the pads in the process, and he can flick it away beyond Williamson this time to square leg
fuller ball, and straighter in line, and he defends from the crease
length ball, on offstump, and he presses forward to defend
length ball on offstump, and he presses forward to defend
fuller ball, and angling into him from around the stumps, and he blocks
length ball, but more outside off, and this time Sohail can use the pace of the ball to steer it towards third man
straighter ball, and he looks to work it away on the onside. Goes too close to short midwicket
strays down the pads, and he looks to glance it away. Takes the pads, perhaps, but Watling does well to cut it off, diving away to his left. Good stuff!
fuller ball, outside off, and he can ease into a drive. Takes him to 94 now!
fuller, on off stump, and he drives, but cannot beat short cover
fuller ball, on offstump, and he presses forward and defends
strays down the pads, and he is able to glance this fine enough. Just two short of that hundred now!
length ball, on offstump, and he shoulders arms
fires this outside off, with a hint of movement back in. Sohail drives, but cannot beat short cover
bangs the first in short, but the line is outside off. Gives Azam time to plonk it away on the onside, rolling his wrists along the way
comes round the wicket, and bangs this in short too. Sohail ducks under it, but must be careful, as the ball didn't get up much
short again, and starts from outside leg. Angled across the batsman, but this is hardly the pitch to get any purchase with this length. Sohail ducks under it again
short again, but closer to the stumps. Sohail gets up on his toes and drives it towards cover
short ball yet again, and Sohail ducks under it. The commentators have a laugh about how umpire Paul Reiffel isn't calling them short balls, but they are not really rearing up enough
short, and this time close to his body, and he can flick it away towards long leg.
massive appeal. But he's got an inisde edge on the forward defence
full outside off, jams it down the pitch
inside edge. As he pushes forward outside off. This jumps up and lobs into the leg side off his bat, but there's no short leg
beaten in flight, but he manages to get his body behind it and poke into the off side. That was pushed through flat
length on off stump, defended into the off side
beaten in flight again but he manages to get some pad on this. Nervous, nervous batting from Haris. Steps out and if this didn't turn into him, he'd be gone
short and wide outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
bouncer down leg side, ducks under it
full and wide outside off, jams it into the covers, well away from the body
nicely timed, but straight to cover. Overpitched outside off, half a stride and a high elbow on this drive
short one at off stump, hurriedly pulls, but harmlessly in the end. Straight to midwicket
'no!' screams Haris, after driving this to mid-on. Thought about it and Babar was responsive, but a quick change in mind and a good call
length outside off, leans in and defends on the front foot. Thick inside edge towards short midwicket
inside edge as he looks to punch through the off side against a big turner. Gosh this anxious from Haris. Onto this thigh guard as he's still on the move
nearly runs past this! A googly from Sodhi, short and wide and he has stepped out too early. Just manages to stab at this and get bat on it

there it is! The pursuit of that last run has been like much of the rest of his innings. A bit of a struggle, some of his doing, but like the rest of his innings, he has survived, he has kept his head about it, and he's brought up the runs. Second Test hundred for Haris Sohail, got by tucking a full ball to mid-on's left. He's been good down the ground, and that's where he gets the big run. A relieved acknowledgement of the dressing room, most of which was in splits over the last few minutes. Kisses the ground, says a prayer, and a reserved smile from the man
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half
back to the grind. A bouncer slanted in at middle stump line. Gets under it to let it pass

clean hit. Babar goes against the turn, but he's got it completely right because of his footwork. Meets it at a length outside off and puts in a lovely golf swing to send it high over long-on

length at off stump, blocked on the front foot

short and spinning in at off stump. Backs away and cuts through point
short and just outside off. One again he backs into the leg side, watches closely and chops it square

beaten on the outside edge. Short of a length ball turning and bouncing sharply as he backs away and looks for the cut. Complete loss of balance there
