fuller in length, and bowled only at 121.6kph. He keeps it out comfortably
straighter ball, and he is able to work it off his legs to square leg
length ball that turns big from off to leg, and he can work it off his pads to square leg
short, and he can rock back and cut it away. There's a sweeper at extra cover, though
short, and asking to be hit! Turns from off to middle, but gives him time to use the depth of the crease and pull it away
goes back and defends a length ball

goes back and forces a length ball past the man at point. There's some work to do for the sweeper, who is also a left-handed fielder, and before Boult can rifle his throw in, they have time to pick up three
defends a length ball on offstump
straight ball, cutting back into Azam, who comes forward and defends compactly
straight ball, and again some inward movement. Takes the inside of the bat as he looks to drive it down around his front pad
straight ball again, and some inward movement. This time, Azam stays behind the line and defends away on the onside
straight ball, and he is able to play it off his hips to square leg
outside off stump, and he shoulders arms, as CDG comes around the wicket
straight ball, and this time he defends it straight down the wicket
channel outside off, and he lets it pass
outside off, and moving away, and he shoulders arms
takes the edge! This was angled in, and Azam played the wrong line. The ball could easily have cannoned into the offstump, but just took the outside edge and then crept along the ground to third man
length ball, and he defends off the front foot
outside off, and dying as it goes through to Watling. Azam shoulders arms.
angles into him, and he comes forward to defend
length ball, outside off, and he comes forward and blocks
length ball, outside off, and he plays it defensively off the crease to the offside
outside off, and this time it gives him room to steer it towards backward point
comes forward to a length ball, and it runs off his inside edge down to the onside. He doesn't know much about it, but Sohail calls him through for a quick single
length ball, that he presses forward and defends straight back down the wicket
fuller in length, and he drives it, but straight to mid-off
outside off, on a length, and swinging away with the shiny side away from the right-hander. Azam can let this pass
outside off, and shaping further away. Azam presses forward, and then takes his bat out of the way
outside off, and a bit quicker (132.4k) this time. Azam gets a cut going, but cannot beat the man at gully
outside off, and this time Azam looks to drive but plays inside the line of it. Missed the outside edge, but not by much!
strays on to the pads, and allows him to whip it away off his legs down to long leg
shorter in length, and cutting into him from wide of the crease. He is up on his tippy-toes to defend
length ball, and he presses forward to block
length ball, and he plays it defensively off the crease
comes forward to defend a length ball
fuller in length, and he drives it back to de Grandhomme, who is quick to pick it up and underarm it back at the stumps
straight ball, on a length, and he goes back to defend this straight down the wicket
strays down the leg side, but Watling does exceptionally well to collect this. Even checks to see if Sohail has overbalanced, and then takes his cape off, and puts his glasses back on...
shorter in length, and he goes back to defend this straight ball
bowled from wide of the crease, and dug in short. Azam plays it off his hips, but cannot beat short midwicket
outside off, and pitched up, and he drives it to cover
outside off, and moving away from a good length, and Azam lets it pass
a beauty! Pitches on leg, and swings away, and beats him all ends up. Too good for Azam!
angles across him, and he allows the ball to come off the face of the bat to steer it down towards backward point
tossed up, on offstump, and he comes forward to drive it down the pitch
tossed up, and a bit straighter this time. Sohail plays it late, off the back foot, and steers it past short midwicket
uses his feet to chip down the wicket of a ball starting from middle, and whips it away over midwicket. There's a man at long-on who gets around to it, though
TAKE THAT! Azam skips down the wicket, and goes inside out, with the turn, and goes over the vacant long-off region
tossed up still, and he drives it straight back down the wicket
presses forward to a length ball, and defends to the offside
full ball, and Sohail caught in the crease, but can just jam his bat down in time. It takes the inside edge on to his foot!
length ball, and he presses forward to defend
outside off, and he is able to ease into it through covers. The ball travels slowly, but teases the fieldsman before crossing over past the ropes
cuts back in sharply from a length, and this time Sohail gets behind the line and defends
yorker, and swinging in to him. Sohail does well to not overbalance and push it away to the onside
fuller ball again, and this time Sohail drives it down the ground
length just outside off, defended into the off side on the front foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to long-off off the toe end
length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket's left
full outside off, nicely to the pitch to drive to sweeper cover
googly at a length on middle stump. Gets forward to defend and it's a thick outside edge, rolling past first slip
short and wide outside off, mistimed pull to deep midwicket
get out of the way Babar! Sohail drills an overpitched ball straight at his partner's helmet, but Babar is alive to the situation and concentrating. Falls to the floor immediately and lets it pass
length ball just outside off, poked to deep point's right off the outside half
length and just outside off, defended to cover off the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
yorker at leg stump as Babar shuffles a long way. But he watches this very very closely and tickles it fine
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
full and into the pads. Flicked through square leg off the front foot
length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
full and swung in at leg stump. Defended into the leg side
full at leg stump, driven straight to mid-on
length outside off, defended to point on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven straight back at the bowler
full at leg stump, defended to short midwicket off the inside half
length outside off, defended to point with the turn
full on middle stump, gets forward and follows the turn with his hand as he defends
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven down the pitch
tossed up outside off, driven straight back to the bowler
length ball fired wide down leg side. Watling does superbly to fling himself at this and parry it to fine leg's left. They come back for a tight second run
length on off stump, defended off the front foot
length ball in at off stump, solidly blocked on the front foot
full outside off, drives straight to extra cover
length on off stump. An offcutter. Defended solidly on the front foot
length ball just outside off, off the inside edge to square leg as he looks to defend
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, tapped to extra cover's left
beaten. Ajaz foxes Babar who is in a quite awful position. Feet rooted to the crease as he fires in a quicker one outside off and Babar is looking to drive using only his hands. Narrowly misses off
length outside off, stabbed to point
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, defended to mid-on
full and dipping late onto the pads. Flicks off the inside half to short midwicket
length ball just outside off, blocked into the off side
offcutter just outside off, defended to point
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on off the front foot
short of a length outside off, chops to gully's right
length at leg stump, defended into the pitch
short of a length outside off, punched to cover's left
length at middle stump, gets low, allows it to rise and helps it fine with an angled bat. Taylor gives chase and pulls it back
length at off stump, turns into the bat and pings through square leg off the inside edge
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball angled down leg side, flicked to fine leg
length ball at off stump, shuffles and whips it straight to square leg
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
slower ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, steps out and drives to long-on
short of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
length outside off, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and chops it to sweeper's left
length outside off, driven against the turn to extra cover
short of a length just outside off, cut to sweeper's right
length ball well down leg side, can't get bat on that
short of a length outside off, punched to cover's right and steals a run. Gets in the way of a throw at the non-striker's end and doesn't seem happy about it. Not sure why.
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
slower ball, looped up at a length outside off. Blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full ball at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full and drifted in at leg stump, flicked to short fine
outside edge but there's no slip in. Length ball floated up outside off, pokes at it with soft hands and gets two for it
length outside off, tapped through point on the up
length outside off, looks to defend and gets an inside edge onto pad
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot

run-out chance! Ajaz Patel with some sensational work at backward point, but he can't get the direct hit in. Length ball outside off, he slices on the up and takes off but Ajaz dives one-handed to the left and stops this. Babar was sent back and it would have been marginal if this had hit
length ball. Slower ball. Defended into the off side
just keeps this out. Beaten by pace again. It's a slower ball at yorker length and he nearly gets him to fall over and chip it
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length ball down at leg stump. Shuffles and flicks with the angle to fine leg
crafty. Slower ball at a length just outside off. Arches into the leg side and chops this past gully
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length on middle stump, leans in and flicks to square leg
length outside off, steps out and flicks to short midwicket
length on middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
defended down the pitch. A tossed up all on off and he dead-bats it
pitched up, and he slices it away past point
pitched up on a good length, and he presses forward to defend
shaping in off a length, and he defends off the front foot
dug in short, and he ducks into it. The ball doesn't bounce a lot, and also passes close to the periscope. Boult calls one for the over himself, and then shares a chuckle with the umpire
drifts into the pads, and Sohail is able to flick it beyond short midwicket
width on offer, but he can only steer it to point
pitches on off and turns in, and he defends from the crease
tossed up, and he drives it on the onside, but straight to square leg
shorter, and he can rock back and push it away on the onside. Cannot beat the fielder at square leg
goes back and defends a length ball
short and he forces it away on the offside, but cannot beat the short cover!
comes forward and defends this

BOULT GETS HIS DUE REWARD! Length ball, and has Sohail nibbling at it for once. Collected coolly by Watling, and it brings a terrific vigil to an end. Boult has his first, and is just the third Kiwi bowler to have picked a wicket in this match. Also the first wicket for today for the visitors!
full ball, angling across him, and Sarfraz just about pokes it away tentatively
length ball, outside off, and he pokes it away on the offside. There's hesitation, but the fielder at point cannot pick it up
length ball, angles across him, and he defends it off the crease.

THIS TIME HE MAKES NO MISTAKE! Strays on to the pads off a length, and he tucks it away off his pads, and picks up the runs to bring up his first Test century. Puffs his cheeks in relief, as Sarfraz comes in and gives him some glove-love. Well played, young man!
length ball on off stump, and he defends
outside off, and beats the outside edge, as he looks to steer it torwards third man
defends a length ball with a forward press
looks to sweep a length ball, and it nearly carries to Raval fielding at square leg. Uppish, but just short!
shimmies down the track, and takes the ball on the half-volley, and forces it with some power through the mid-off region
tossed up, and he uses the spin and the pace of the ball to steer it towards backward point
short in length, and he can go back and cut it away to the sweeper at backward point
length ball, angles across him, and he goes back and defends
length ball, angles across him, and he dabs it away off the back foot to the offside
length ball, a bit straighter and quicker (136k) and Sarfraz is happy to defend this off the crease
DROPPED AT SECOND SLIP! Fast and full, and wide of offstump, and he looks to guide it towards third man. Latham, with the helmet on, sees the ball go in and out. Poor from New Zealand
length ball on the pads, and he nurdles it away towards long leg
length ball, on offstump, that he defends off the crease
length ball, and he does well to hang back and then push it away past point
comes forward and defends a length ball
presses forward to a length ball and defends
goes back to a shorter ball and pushes it through point

tossed up, and he goes for a sweep, but misses it. New Zealand want to review this for LBW! The ball is pitched on middle and then straightens, but the only issue could be height, as it seems to have eluded both bat and glove, as Sarfraz looks to lap it down to fine leg. There's a hint of deviation when it comes close to the gloves, and that will be the decisive factor for TV umpire Ian Gould. Yes, it has taken the glove along the way, that too of the bottom hand! The ball then went into his body and on to the ground. Will stay not out.
short and he pushes it through covers
angles across him, but is short in length, and he punches it off the backfoot. A great bit of work from the man at cover, Raval, who is able to pull it back just in time
short, and he pulls it away with languid ease. Doesn't need much of footwork either, as he leans back and goes in front of square on the onside. Top-notch!
fuller ball, and with some late swing away from Azam, who is square up, but is able to take it on the full and defend
length ball, and quick! Clocks at 135k as it angles across Azam, who comes forward to defend
length ball, outside off, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, and he presses forward to defend it on off-stump
tossed up, and full, and Sarfraz looks to guide it towards point
tossed up, and he is able to reach out and drive it through mid-off
tossed up outside leg, and then turns back in, and Azam is able to dead-bat it with a slightly open stance
fired in a bit quicker, and he goes back and defends
fired in straight, and he guides it with soft hands towards midwicket
tossed up, and he drives it down towards the deep mid-off (not deep enough to be long-off)
length ball, angles across him, and he pokes at it towards point off the backfoot
a little short, and he does well to use the pace of the ball and guide it past gully down to third man
angles in from wide of the crease, and he comes forward and defends it comfortably
full ball, and he defends off the front foot
full ball, outside off, and he drives it firmly, but straight to mid-off
length ball, but strays on to the pads, and he can tuck it away with a tidy flick down to fine leg
length ball, and he goes on to the back foot and clips it away on the onside
length ball, and he goes back and cuts, but cannot beat point
tossed up, and nearly yorks Sarfraz, who drives back to the bowler
outside off, turning further away, and he eases it towards point
tossed up, and he looks to go back to this and drive it through covers
shorter in length, and this time he gets it past Nicholls at cover
angles across him, on a good length, and he is happy to shoulder arms to this
length ball, and he looks to do an old-fashioned tip and run, but realises the ball has dropped far too close to Boult
length ball, and he defends it off the back foot on to the legside
length ball, straightening back into him, and he does well to get some bat into it, going towards short midwicket. Good spell this from Boult...
pitched up, and a hint of swing back in again! Takes the inside edge, and could have gone anywhere. Just bouncing over the offstump.
angles across him, and moves further away, as he lets it pass
outsde off, and he takes it on the full to squirt it away past point
GOOD SHOT STRAIGHT DOWN THE GROUND! Some flight on offer, and he goes down the pitch and lofts him over the vacant mid-on region
length ball, with some turn on offer. Sarfraz defends it watchfully from the crease
uses his feet, and Ajaz alters his length by bowling it full. Sarfraz pushes it away through cover
length ball, that he looks to work against the turn down to fine leg
tossed up, and he defends it from the crease
length ball, and he can only drop it on offstump, straight towards point
length ball, outside off, and Sarfraz miscues an almighty heave towards mid-off. The ball trickles down the wicket on the legside
slower through the air, outside off, and he looks to nurdle it down towards third man, but cannot beat point
outside off, and he has a swing and a miss, as the ball keeps a tad bit low
slower ball on offstump, and he dabs and runs. Tom Latham has a shy at the striker's end, and doesn't miss by much! Azam would have been a goner had this hit!
length ball on off stump, and he defends off the crease
tossed up, and he presses forward to defend
tossed up, and he opens up his stance to drive it down to long-off.
length ball, and he defends it off the crease
fired in quicker, and he chooses to defend it off the crease
tossed up, and he guides it towards third man with the tide, off the backfoot
tossed up, and he flicks it away to short midwicket
length ball, and he presses forward to defend

length ball, and Azam takes the ball down on the offside with a dead bat, and sets off! Sent back in time, thankfully, otherwise, we would have seen another good innings come to an end with a brain-fade
length ball, slower through the air, on off-stump, that he looks to dab towards third man, but cannot beat point
shorter in length, and as Azam plays this defensively, he seems to pull away in some pain. Cramps?
pitched up, and he presses forward and defends.
ptiched fuller, and he drives it to mid-on
tossed up, and he uses his feet to get to the pitch of it, and whip it away nonchalantly through midwicket. Aerial, but safe, as there's no fielder in that position
tossed up, and he comes forward to defend
length ball, and he dabs it with an open face down to third man
uses his feet, but Ajaz adjusts his length, and forces Azam to smother the ball straightening from leg
short ball, he goes back and forces it towards point
angles down the leg side, and allows him to dab it away towards square leg.
length and in at middle stump, punched on the up to mid-on
length ball outside off, sliced to backward point
length outside off, walks down at it and looks to loft it over mid-off. Ends up slicing it high and wide of him, but not with enough force
slower ball at a length on off stump, walks down and checks the shot to get this to mid-off
slower ball at a length on off stump, driven with the turn to extra cover
length ball outside off, mistimed punch on the up to cover point
short and turning away wide outside off. Guides it to short third's left
short and wide outside off, cut straight to extra cover
short of a length outside off, jabbed to sweeper cover with the turn
googly, short and down leg side. Pulls to long leg
clears the midwicket boundary. That's very short and sits up nicely outside off. Holds a strong base and creams this pull
length ball turning away from off, jabbed to short third off the thick outside edge
length ball just outside off, left alone
nicely played. Full ball at middle and leg. Watches it closely and whips it wide of mid-on. The ball races away, well visible as it reflects the floodlights
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full inswinger floats onto his pad. He falls over a touch with the stride across, but he's watching it closely as he flicks through square leg
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outisde off, looks to chop at this and it skids from under the bat
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone

nicely timed. Length ball just outside off. He leans in and taps it on the up, fully balanced as he does so. It dribbles through extra cover and Azhar Ali gives chase from mid-off. Puts in a slide and pulls it back, but his hand is jammed between the ball and the boundary padding as he does so
length at middle stump, defended solidly down the pitch
short and wide outside off, left alone
short at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
length at off stump, defended to point off the front foot
length ball jags away from middle stump, but he's behind this nicely to defend into the covers
length ball just outside off, defended to midwicket off the inside half
length ball just outside off, big inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended solidly into the covers
floated up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, lots of time to get back and defend this
full on leg stump, flicked through midwicket
full on leg stump, nicely forward to defend down the pitch
full on leg stump, driven straight to mid-on
length ball angled in at leg stump, defended to short leg
well played. Nice and confident from Raval so far. This is full on the pads from over the wicket, he leans into it and flicks cleanly to the midwicket boundary
length ball down at leg stump, flicked to deep backward square
length at leg stump, gets deep in the crease and tucks it through square leg
length ball at middle and off. Inside edge onto pad falls short of the fielder on the leg side
short of a length ball at off stump, spins down leg side
length outside off, gets the front leg well outside off and defends
full outside off, defended off the outside half as he plays slightly inside this
beaten. Length ball drifts in outside off and rips away as he looks to block
tossed up on off stump, driven with the turn to mid-off
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and in at middle stump. Punched to mid-on off the back foot
full on middle stump, dead-batted on the front foot
short of a length and turning into leg stump. Gets on the back foot and tickles it behind square
full outside off, carves it off the outside half to point's right
length ball, flat and turning sharply into the pads. Deflected between keeper and leg slip
full outside off, big stride ahead to defend
full outside off, defended into the off side
length ball on middle stump, flicked to short leg off the back foot
length ball skids back into the corridor. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, defends onto his boot off the back foot
short of a length outside off, tapped to backward point's left
length ball turning away from off stump. Defended off the back foot
length ball skids on at an off stump. Looks to defend off the back foot. Gets it off the inside edge
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball, straight, and he defends
length ball, angles across him, and keeps low as he shoulders arms to it
length ball, and he defends
length ball, that angles across him, and he lets it pass
length ball, a bit straighter this, and he flicks it away to square leg
strays down leg, but Latham cannot get a bat to it as he shapes to glance
length ball, shapes across him after pitching, and he leaves it
angles across him, and is pitched up, and he drives towards cover
shorter in length, and he goes back and defends a straight ball
pitched up, and he drives it towards cover as the ball slants across him
length ball, straighter, and he goes back and pushes it away towards short midwicket
angles across him, and he lets it pass
length ball, outside off, and he lets it pass
length ball, angles across him, and he shoulders arms to it. Low bounce yet again through to Sarfraz...
pitched up, and he comes forward to defend. Oversteps in the process, though
length ball, straightens into him, and he flicks it away off his hips. Better from Abbas - at least he is forcing Latham to play at the ball
length ball, and this time starts and stays outside off, and he can shoulder arms to it
pitched up, and angles into him, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, outside off, and he shoulders arms to it

DROPPED! This is angled across Raval, and he pokes at it and it goes to second slip. It was dying along the way, but the man at second slip, Asad Shafiq, should have done better. Just didn't stay low enough
length ball, and defends it off the back foot
length ball, outside off, and he defends from the crease
length ball, angled from leg towards off, and Raval takes a good look at it and then makes an exaggerated leave
length ball, on offstump, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, and he drives it back to the bowler, who half-stops it
length ball, straightens into him, and he presses forward to defend it right under his nose
pitched up a bit more, still outside off stump, and he presses forward to drive it on the onside
length ball, and he stays in the crease and taps it away on the onside after rising on his toes
length ball, just on offstump, and Latham gets behind the line and drops it dead at his feet
length ball, and he can comfortably go back and drop it defensively on the onside
pitched up, and he drives towards cover
length ball, straight, and he goes back to defend
pitched up, and he drives it straight back at the bowler. Hasan gets a hand to it
angles across him, on a good length, and he leaves it alone
pitched up, and angled across Raval, who leaves it alone
length ball, angles across him, and keeps a bit low as it goes through to Sarfraz. Raval is having none of it
length ball, angles across him and moves further away. Guess what Raval does? That's correct - leaves it alone!
tossed up, and he drives it straight back to the bowler
goes wide of the crease in trying to toss it into the footmarks, and Latham sweeps it down to fine leg, getting his feet behind the line of the ball
tossed up, and he presses forward to defend. Beats the inside edge, and thuds into the pad, but clearly would have gone down the legside
tossed up, and Raval tries to drive, and gets the inside part of the bat as it squirts away to short midwicket
wide of the crease, and tossed up, and he waits for it to come to him this time. Times it through covers
tossed up, and he presses forward to defend. It takes the inside of the bat and goes towards fine leg
length ball, angles across him, and he shoulders arms to it
length ball, and it angles across him, as he lets it pass through
angles across, and he leaves it
ptiched up, and gives some width in doing so. Raval eases into a cover drive
bowls from wide of the crease, angling it in, and Latham comes forward to defend
length ball, and he comes forward to defend as it moves into him with the natural angle
tossed up, and the turn beats his inside edge. Catches him on the pad as he stretches forward, but probably had an impact outside off
similar ball, turning back in from the rough, and beats the bat to strike pad. A louder appeal this time, but again impact should have been just outside off
presses forward to defend another ball on a length outside off
tossed up, and a bit fuller this time, and allows Raval to use his considerable reach to smother it
comes forward to smother another ball pitched outside off and turning into him from the rough
tossed up, and this time Raval is able to flick it along the ground through the midwicket region
length ball, but drifts into the pads, and he can flick it away towards square leg
shorter, and again strays a bit too straight, and Latham can tuck it away off his pads to the square leg region
length ball, outside off, and he shoulders arms to it
shorter, and straighter, and forces the batsman to go back and defend it straight down the wicket
length ball, outside off, and he is happy to shoulder arms to it
length ball, and he leaves outside off. There's decent bounce on this as it goes through to Sarfraz
tossed up, and he reverses it down to third man. Completely in control, as he rolls his wrists in picking that ball from outside off
starts from middle and turns big, and goes down the leg side

tossed up, and this time the conventional sweep. Good use of the wrists to get over the ball and keep it down, and played late too. Good way to counter Yasir, who should be the big threat on this pitch
length ball, and he plays it off the backfoot, with the turn, and soft hands
tossed up and he drives it with the turn to mid-on
big turn and bounce as it turns from outside off, and takes glove. Goes past the man at leg gully and trickles down to fine leg
defends a length ball down the pitch
left alone outside off
fuller of a length ball, straightens outside off, Raval pushes at it and gets an outside edge through the gap between the slips and gully
taps it into the off side for a quick one
straight length ball outside off, left alone
length ball that angles in from well outside off, left alone
flat, drifts in from outside off and spins down leg
back of a length ball, turning in, tucked off the hips to backward square leg
floated up on middle and off, swept behind square leg

bowled him! A little unfortunate as it was inadvertent, but you're always in with that risk to an unconventional shot such as the reverse sweep. Gets hit on the thigh with the impact outside off, but as the ball rolls back off the thigh and as he's completing the bat swing, the ball clips the back of the bat and then goes onto the stumps. A freak dismissal, but there was an element of risk involved that gave way to it
forward to block a fuller ball to point
pushes this to mid-off on the front foot

length ball, swings back into his pads, and he plays it with the tide to the onside, and they set off for a run. The fielder has a shy at the non-striker's end, and a direct hit could have been interesting!
length ball, outside off, and lures Nicholls into a forward defensive prod, not unlike Latham. Just beats the outside edge this time!

a little flatter and quicker, towards leg, and he tries to go back and work it around the corner, but it  beats the bat and hits his thigh
presses forward to defend a length ball on middle and leg
flipper, but slow as it goes through to Nicholls, who can go back and defend it from middle stump
length ball, angles into him, and he presses forward to defend
length ball, strays down the pads, and allows him to tuck it away towards fine leg
length ball, straight at him, and he drives it down the onside with ease
length ball, and he presses forward and defends. I kid you not, the pitch is so slow, this was like a forward defensive stroke to a spinner!
length ball, and angles away from him after pitching, as he leaves
fuller, and down the leg side, and he has no problems in just using the pace of the ball to play it down to fine leg. Valiant effort from Bilal Asif, but he cannot stop it
presses forward and blocks a length ball on off stump

presses forward to defend a length ball
goes back and defends a length ball turning back into him
shorter, and he can sweep this one after getting down on one knee. Cannot beat the man at square leg, though

length ball, that angles into him and hits the pad. Pakistan want this wicket, but the umpire thinks he may have nicked it. They go upstairs. It actually looks like it may have gone down leg. This will be especially difficult as the original decision was not out. Pitched ok and impact was fine, but the third colour is green. Not out!
fuller, and he plays it away on the onside, keeping it low enough to avert short midwicket
fuller length, and he drives it back down to the bowler, who stops it. Well...half-stops it, but does well enough
length ball, hits his pad as he shapes to flick it. Taylor wants a single, but Nicholls reckons short midwicket is far too close to the ball
fuller ball, and again angles into him. He comes forward and defends it away on the onside. Must be mindful of the man at short midwicket
straight ball, he prods forward and defends
length ball at off and middle, dead-batted into the pitch
lovely shot. The attack is on his legs, so hits it into the off side. Behind square with a reverse sweep, nicely getting to the pitch of that and keeping his head over the ball
length at off stump, swept along the floor to deep backward square
length ball spinning at middle stump, pitching outside leg. He lets it onto his thigh with bat out of the way
length ball spinning at the stumps from outside leg again. Kicked away
tossed up wide outside off. Kicked away
length ball wide outside off, left alone

length ball outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, with a hint of curve away. Leans into the forward block
length ball shaping away from off stump. Can't get him to play at this
tossed up outside leg stump, padded away
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
length ball at leg stump, kicked away
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
length ball wide outside off, looks to sweep. Cops it on the forearm, outside the line
full outside off, dead-batted into empty covers region

full on middle stump, driven to mid-on's right and Yasir slides to his right to stop
length outside off, looks to tap it into the covers, gets an inside edge to square leg

full and down leg side, looks to sweep and misses that. So does keeper. So does leg slip.
beaten but that's into the body. Length ball at middle stump, steps out and is nowhere near the pitch of this as he looks to flick

falls short of deep backward square. Sarfraz is angry, surprise surprise. Length ball on middle stump, looks to sweep that and gets a top edge. That was well short of the fielder. The captain not happy that Yasir was as deep as he is
tossed up wide outside off, paddles to deep backward square

full on leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
length on middle stump, defended into the leg side

Yasir is in this time and he takes it! Pakistan have made the adjustment and Taylor has given them the same chance again. Very loose from Taylor, but it was coming. He had been fidgety, the last 15 minutes or so. Looks for another sweep and isn't anywhere near the pitch of that. Closes the face too early and lobs up a leading edge for Yasir at deep backward square. He runs in five yards and holds on easily
length ball outside off, blocked on the front foot
outside edge falls short of slip. Length ball just outside off, pokes with hard hands

beats the outside edge. Length ball outside off, gets forward and low, hears this fizz past

just misses off stump! Oh to have this ability. That would have been the perfect legbreak it it got the stumps. Drifts in towards leg stump, makes him defend at middle because, of course, it'll turn, won't it? It does, but it's past the bat and narrowly past off stump

big lbw shout as he bat-pads on the front foot. Not out says the umpire and they don't have reviews left. That wasn't a bad shout on line. The only decision to be made there was whether it was bat or pad first. Umpire thinks the former
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
length outside off, keeps the bat inside the line and leaves

beats the edge. Flatter, length, spinning away. Nicholls is caight on the move, half-stride

dropped short again. Gets back and gets better connection this time. Still slicing as it spins away, but it's into the big gap at square leg

he's been given lbw. Surely, he'll review that. No he doesn't. Watling is gone! Was he timed out there? Hard to tell. But he's gone. A straighter one from Yasir, traps him on the pad after beating the inside edge. It's on the middle-and-leg line so a review might have been on. But that's it. That's what they needed, Pakistan. Yasir gets Watling. Now he's got 10 of New Zealand's 11 batsmen in the match. Replays confirm that was hitting the top of leg.
googly, dropped short and wide outside off. Mistimed cut to point's right
length on leg stump, poked into the leg side off the front foot
length ball just outside off, tapped to mid-off on the up
length just outside off, tapped into the off side
supreme. Wow. What a shot that is. Length ball just outside off, some shape in and a gorgeous forward stride as he drills this right off the middle to beat mid-off. Perfect, just perfect.
length and in at leg stump, stands tall and whips this wide of mid-on off the back foot
loose. Length ball outside off, some shape in again. This time CDG with no stride, swishing away from the body at it. Inside edge to fine leg

off the boot but safely into the leg side. Full toss on the pads. Looks to flick and whips it onto his boot. Short leg is taking protective cover and isn't alive to the opportunity as this lobs behind him

goes through with the swing after being out of control momentarily. It's a length ball, offcutter outside off. CDG is always going for the drive but he has to adjust here. Launches it wide of mid-off on the end

engines whirring! Hasan Ali runs down the pitch and pulls the chain. CDG will be embarrassed with this shot, no doubt. A length ball in at off stump. Keeps low on him a touch but that's probably because he wasn't on the front foot. It's a hoick. He's stood tall and hoicked. And he's lost his stumps, which is what happens.

lovely. Steps out, meets the ball outside off and launches it with the turn over mid-on. Fully in control.

climbs past the bat. Length ball dipping nicely and taking to beat the edge

exposes the stumps and is bowled trying to sweep. That looks like a shot he's attempted for the first time. And if it is, he's picked the worst time. Complete lapse there from Sodhi, who has been nicely behind the line to every ball he's faced till now. This was tossed up at middle, spinning towards off. He was at least four stumps wide of off stump attempting to lap this fine. Quite the manufactured wicket that, it was a harmless length ball.

trapped on the back thigh and he's in line of the stumps. This skids through quickly from around the wicket. Did he get bat on that? There were certainly two noises. He was looking to play the flick. Pakistan has no reviews left, of course. Replays show ball was sliding down.

flipper, pitching on leg and going straighter on, and he defends off the backfoot

beats him by going straight on after pitching. Lovely bowling, and Wagner beaten all ends up!

dug in short, and again goes down the leg side. Nicholls misses with another attempted pull, and the ball dies on its way to Sarfraz, and just strikes the right of his jaw

DONE HIM IN! Length ball, and just a little bit of movement in, and creeps through the tightest of gaps between bat and pad. Nicholls stretched forward, but his feet never really got close enough to the pitch of the ball. The bat was quite far forward, and the ball goes in with the natural angle, and clips the top of off. The clearing of the throat is on...
beats the outside edge with a beautiful length ball! Ajaz looks to come forward, but doesn't get close enough to it

length ball, straightens into him, and raps him on the pad. BIG APPEAL! No review left, though. Probably just a bit high, though Ajaz was caught in the crease

struck him on the pads again, as he looks for a slog sweep. Impact might have been outside off though!
three in three, as it beats the inside edge, as Wagner stretches forward to defend a ball pitching outside off and turning back in sharply!
pulls out the reverse paddle sweep, as the ball is pitched into the rough outside off stump
looks for the conventional sweep this time, and it balloons over Sarfraz and then eludes Asad Shafiq at leg slip! Close shave, and what an over this was!
length ball, but strays on to the pads, and he flicks it gracefully through midwicket

Bowled from the back of the hand, and a good catch by Hasan Ali, sprawling away in front after running a fair distance. The sajda from Yasir, who has a chance to match Imran Khan's 14 wickets in a match...

IT'S OVER! YASIR HAS 14! Tosses this up, and Boult looks to come forward and defend, but gets a feather edge as it spins viciously past his bat and is collected by Sarfraz. Instant appeal and celebration from the bowler and his teammates, and the dreaded finger goes up as well. Eight in the first and six in the second for Yasir Shah.
